SEARCH
Package ru.introguzzle.parsers.common.field

Interface FieldAccessor

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractFieldAccessor, JSONFieldAccessor, XMLFieldAccessor
public interface FieldAccessor
Interface for accessing and retrieving fields from a given class.

Implementations of this interface are responsible for providing a list of Field instances that are relevant for processing, such as serialization or deserialization.

Important: There is no need to call setAccessible(true) on the fields returned by the acquire(Class) method, as they are already accessible. This design choice ensures that reflection operations remain efficient and do not require additional security permissions.

Implementations should consider caching the results of the get method to optimize performance, especially when dealing with classes that are accessed frequently.

See Also:

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    @NotNull List<Field>
    acquire(@NotNull Class<?> type)
    Retrieves an immutable List of Field instances from the specified class that are relevant for processing.

  • Method Details

    • acquire

      @NotNull @NotNull List<Field> acquire(@NotNull @NotNull Class<?> type)
      Retrieves an immutable List of Field instances from the specified class that are relevant for processing. The returned fields are already accessible, eliminating the need to modify their accessibility using setAccessible(true).

      This method may filter fields based on certain criteria, such as annotations, access levels, or exclusion rules defined by the implementing class.

      Implementations are encouraged to cache the results of this method to enhance performance and reduce the overhead of repeated reflection operations.

      Parameters:
      type - the Class object from which to retrieve fields
      Returns:
      an immutable List of Field instances that are relevant for processing
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the type parameter is null
